department.dept_long_name: Department of Chemistry and Chemical Biology

course.title: Organic Chemistry
course.meeting_text: Lectures M., W., F., at 11, and laboratory, four to six hours a week, to be arranged.
course.description: Continuation of Chemistry 20. Fundamental principles and advanced topics in organic chemistry. Carbonyl chemistry and pericyclic reactions are covered in particular detail, using principles of stereochemistry, stereoelectronic theory, and molecular orbital theory as a foundation. Students learn about strategies in multi-step organic synthesis and are given an introduction into organometallic chemistry. Laboratory: an introduction to organic chemistry laboratory techniques and experimental organic synthesis.
course.notes: Chemistry 27 and 30 may both be taken for degree credit. See note for Chemistry 17.
